sn14.13:2.2: Normally I follow BB in adopting naming variations, but the support for saddha kaccayana seems very slim. In addition to being used in Thai and Burmese editions, Kaccana is also found in the comm.
sn14.13:3.1: This calls into question BB’s rendering of pannayati throughout as “is discerned”. While the text doesn’t explicitly says this, the clear implication is that the the former view depends on the element of ignorance. But it is very strange to say something “is discerned because of the element of ignorance”.
sn14.13:3.2: I find it very odd to see puggala in this list.
